I tried using Svelte to build a small project, and it felt great. Thereâ€™s no need to write separate CSS files, no hassle with props or state. useEffect and useState are almost handled implicitly for me, and thereâ€™s no unnecessary boilerplate code. Using stores is also super convenient. From now on, Iâ€™ve decided to use Svelte for all my new projects!

My mom sent me a Douyin wedding invitation screenshot of my first crush from elementary school celebrating his wedding during this New Year. I could barely recognize who it was without seeing the name. Getting married - everyone's starting to get married. This path that was once considered the most natural course of life has now become something I completely exclude from my life plans. Looking back, I've really come a long way, but this is insignificant. I will go much further on my own path. The work is the first line of my obituary. The work is the first line of my obituary.

"What do you live by?"

Translated by Claude:

I used to cope by thinking "if I die, my mom would have to travel across continents alone to collect my body - how pitiful." Now I cope by believing that "although I'm fragile and vulnerable, I trust that I am/want to become an adult who can fall down repeatedly but always get back up."

I've abandoned any illusions about the civility and decency of contemporary Europeans/Americans, and accepted the fact that in this global rightward shift, I will forever be a foreigner without a true homeland. I ignore those who ignore me, and destroy those who offend me. Standing on the remaining heights of globalism, I forever look down upon and pity their narrow and closed-off souls.

Meanwhile, more importantly, I create a spiritual homeland that can support me, ensuring that there I can be seen, heard, and engage in meaningful, deep conversations (for example: what works best for me is reading books, watching films, writing in my journal, and having dialogues with myself).

A few days ago, I stayed indoors due to the extreme cold. Tonight, after class, I took the bus home. After getting off, I was listening to "åˆ°è™•ç•™æƒ…" through my headphones, reaching that incredibly beautiful violin part while walking from the bus stop to my apartment. Snowflakes were drifting in the air, and the surrounding lights were dim. A girl walked past me from the opposite direction, head down and wrapped tightly in her down jacket. Suddenly, a feeling of emotional nostalgia welled up inside me. But there's no one I want to share this with anymore, no one I can share this with anymore.

On the last day of 2024, I sit in my apartment in Chicago, reflecting on my future and the main goals for the next two years. I've been thinking about key themes like Computer Graphics, Technical Artistry, Digital Media, and Creative Tools. Broadly, I want to pursue a field that blends technology and art to make a meaningful impact on people's daily lives.

I understand that reaching my goals will require a significant commitment of time and energy to mastering math, research, coding, and debugging. But if this is the field I am passionate about dedicating my life to, why not start now? If I don't try, I'll regret and will try it one day eventually. If I try, even if I fail, at least Iâ€™ll know I gave it my all.

This is the perfect age to explore, to discover what truly matters to me. As Iâ€™ve decided, for the next two yearsâ€”and beyondâ€”letâ€™s just do it.
